other_tests.findings: The gallbladder contains a 2 cm immobile stone, is distended with a thickened and edematous wall, and layering sludge is seen. There is possible trace pericholecystic fluid and increased echogenicity of the surrounding tissue, indicative of inflamed pericholecystic fat. The liver demonstrates normal echotexture with no focal lesion. The spleen is mildly enlarged, measuring 13.3 cm.
